channel.title: 'The Bunny Kit' RPG legality?
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/hgF19hC.png[/img]
Some time ago, I made a small multiplayer browser-based game using sprites from 'The bunny kit' which was released a few years ago. I had built basic combat, chat, equipping of items and armour and a basic inventory system. Didn't name it or anything, it was mainly an experiment.
Are the creator(s) of the Bunny Kit still around? Would using it inside my game infringe on somebodies IP or copyright? Would I require permission to use this in my game? I highly doubt RuneScape would be able to claim copyright infringement if I had created something so fundamentally different to their game.

item.title: 'The Bunny Kit' RPG legality?
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Pwnd:

If you’re game is important enough for the “supposed” creators of the artwork to send a notice, then why not just comply with the CnD and have a fan make the sprites… Given that you are incapable

I’m quite capable. I would be saving time to focus on the other problems of browser based MMOs.

Thanks for the replies. As I said it was mainly an experiment, I just don’t want to step on anybodies toes, no matter how small or big the game would be. The fact the kit is used throughout (hundreds) of forums, and in some cases sold, leads me to believe it’s not legally bound by any copyright.

Read full topic

item.title: 'The Bunny Kit' RPG legality?
item.dc:creator: @Mezzyscape562 Mezzyscape562
item.description:
@Mezzyscape562 wrote:

Just read the License and see what it states… Find some CC-BY-SA 3.0 Artwork if you are deeply in need, give credits and you’re set. Implement the credits somewhere where they can be noticed, and should be good…

https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/

Read full topic

item.title: 'The Bunny Kit' RPG legality?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

you’re completely fine using copyrighted images as placeholders until you begin to make profit from the game, especially if you make it clear you’re using placeholder assets

If the game ever becomes that big you should already have your own library of sprites in the making, so you can swap if you were to get a cnd

Read full topic

item.title: 'The Bunny Kit' RPG legality?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“tobias222, post:3, topic:550685”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=669597.msg4477556#msg4477556 date=1427061466]
its possible, the good news is that they would have to send you a CnD before any real legal issues arrived you could always change artwork or come to an agreement with them if they are willing.
[/quote]

Thanks, also they would have to prove their creation of the artwork? I have seen this released many times with no copyrights or usage terms specified on any of the release topics.

Makes good quick artwork for a 2d RPG because of the huge selection of items available. I’m surprised nobody has done this before to be honest.[/quote]
Lack of usage terms would imply that you’re not allowed to use it. A simple copyright mark is all that is necessary and you find that on some of the released material.

Read full topic

item.title: 'The Bunny Kit' RPG legality?
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

its possible, the good news is that they would have to send you a CnD before any real legal issues arrived you could always change artwork or come to an agreement with them if they are willing.

Thanks, also they would have to prove their creation of the artwork? I have seen this released many times with no copyrights or usage terms specified on any of the release topics.

Makes good quick artwork for a 2d RPG because of the huge selection of items available. I’m surprised nobody has done this before to be honest.
